title: Provides that restaurants must give notice of price of specials and credit card limitations
summary: Provides that restaurants must conspicuously post and give notice of price of specials and credit card limitations; defines "restaurant" and "specials"; imposes a civil penalty of $100 and a subsequent violation occurring within twelve months of the first violation shall be $250.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2295

TITLE OF BILL:
An act to amend the general business law, in relation to posting of
prices of specials and posting notice of credit card limitations in
restaurants

PURPOSE/SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
The general business law will be amended by adding a new section provid-
ing that restaurants post the prices of specials and any credit card
limitations, identifying food specials as food items that do not appear
on the printed menu, and requiring that whenever a restaurant imposes a
minimum dollar limitation on credit card use, they must post that limit.

JUSTIFICATION:
Under the current laws, a customer could order a special believing it to
be a certain price, and then after eating it find out that the actual
price is more than the customer originally thought. Also, a customer
could plan to pay with a credit card, but not know of the restaurant's
minimum dollar credit card limitation.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
On the 30th day after becoming law.
